pros: Amazing people, wonderful environment! Was so sad to leave.
cons: None, this place was my favorite job.

pros: Good colleagues at the faculty level. Good students, if you treat them with the respect and dignity we all desire.
cons: I don't feel this the proper venue for the airing of grievances large or small, so I will refrain. But as a part of the whole, we are experiencing the same problems as the rest of higher education at the moment.

pros: The time off is unmatched!
cons: My only issue is that I work too far from home and would like to be closer.

review_title: Cool job for starters in the IT world
job_title: Audio/Visual Technician in Flower Mound, TX
pros: If you want to get your feet wet in IT without drowning, A/V tech is a good start at NCTC. If you can hook up a DVD player and have patience to help people with computers issue, you should be good to go.
cons: Not enough opportunities to further enhance your knowledge with ever advancing technologies. You will mostly everything within 6 months to a year.

pros: Flexible schedule, amazing coworkers and management, welcoming environment

pros: The medical, dental and vision benefits.

pros: Flexible work schedule and online options

pros: Wonderful environment, great co-workers, Starbucks on site!

pros: They keep tuition low for students, which gives them a viable alternative to several of the universities in the area in respect to core curriculum.
cons: ...but the low cost for students ensures that adjunct faculty will be Uber driving every evening.

pros: Liked the team atmosphere and mission
cons: Too many budget concerns affecting employment of staff and faculty

review_title: NCTC is the best place I've ever worked at!
pros: The college really does care about the students and their success here and beyond! The departments work well together in order to provide excellent service.  Great management and maybe because in the past I've worked at bigger institutions, but this place feels like it has less office politics and everyone just seems to get along.  No favoritism, at least not in my department.  Last but not least, great work/life balance for those of us who love our jobs but also love spending time with our families! Happy staff = hardworking staff!
cons: Pay is good, but could be better.  Raises are not given based on merit but more of a general raise for all staff (which is not something to complain about since we're still getting raises unlike other places).  We could use more office space and newer buildings maybe because we're growing fast!

pros: They have great benefits. If you need something or want to discuss an issue there is always someone willing to help or listen. Everyone is friendly and works as a team.
cons: I am having to work night shift from 10pm - 6am. I am the only person on campus during these hours. The pay is not enough to take care of my kids and pay bills and it's not what I want to do from now on. I want a career and there is no advancement in being a Security Officer there.

review_title: Great! I loved working at NCTC.
pros: Best benefits, supportive and resourceful HR, great president, amazing faculty. Nicely remodeled campus. Loved the trainings with human resources, just not enough of them.
cons: Crabby payroll lady (putting it nicely - wow, how is she still working there) pay was low for same work 15 mins away in another college district, I-35 horrible not NCTC's fault, lack of space for employees and students is NCTC's fault. Bust out that moldy money and build. No Orientation, No training for position. Really?

review_title: Love being a Lion at NCTC!
pros: I've worked for NCTC for many years & I've been afforded the opportunity for professional development that has furthered my career. We receive wonderful benefits, including paid time off. My job is rewarding & fulfilling & I love my boss & my co-workers. NCTC offers many opportunities for advancement, & I have been fortunate to do so. Very happy to work at NCTC & excited to see what the future holds here.
cons: I would like to be able to donate my sick leave, & this is a policy management is currently working to implement- so that will be great!

review_title: Horrible leadership and clueless board of regents
pros: Great people who care about the institution
cons: Petty and poor leadership. Constant scapegoating.

review_title: Great place to work for those who are passionate about Higher Ed!
pros: Great place to work! Departments work well together and that benefits the students! NCTC staff and faculty really care about its students.
cons: None, it's growing and only going to get better!

pros: Couldn't ask for a better group of people to work with. Also, the students were generally working adults and tended to approach education seriously.
cons: Nothing negative can be said.

job_title: Customer Service Representative Clerk in Irving, TX
pros: Everyday is an opportunity to gain experience in communication and also to solve everyone's problem a step at a time. The working environment at NCTC is amazing.
cons: I cannot think of any.

pros: Being able to share knowledge and experience with young people who want to start or improve their careers
cons: Zero benefits, very little support structure from department leadership

pros: Students are great, and my department heads have all been helpful.
cons: Adjuncts are not well paid, and there is virtually no opportunity to move into full time work.  Support is minimal.
